headline: US FAA not currently considering lifting Boeing 737 MAX production cap
summary: The acting head of the Federal Aviation Administration said he is not currently considering lifting a production cap of 38 planes per month on Boeing's 737 MAX imposed after a January 2024 mid-air emergency involving a new Alaska Airlines Boeing plane missing four key bolts.  "Not at this time," Acting FAA Administrator Chris Rocheleau told reporters after a U.S. House hearing.  Boeing did not immediately comment.

headline: Late-night social media and surprise tariffs complicate Trump's two biggest trade talks

headline: China Weighs Massive Airbus Deal
summary: China is considering placing an order for hundreds of Airbus aircraft as soon as next month, when European leaders visit Beijing to celebrate the countries' long-term ties, according to people familiar with the matter. Bloomberg's Benedict Kammel reports.
